title: A Musical Celebrates the Comedian Harmonists
sub_head: At the National Yiddish Theatre Folksbiene, a work by Barry Manilow looks at the sextet made up of Jews and non-Jews that was a hit in Weimar Germany.
body: What accounts for the intermittent but enduring appeal of the Comedian Harmonists, a male sextet that thrived in Weimar Germany? Largely forgotten until the 1970s, the group has spawned tribute bands, inspired plays and movies, and obsessed the pop star Barry Manilow.
